vision.notes: As predatory fish, Caturidae likely relied on vision for hunting in coastal marine and freshwater environments. Inferred based on the predatory lifestyle similar to gars and barracudas.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely possessed a lateral line system common in fish for detecting water movement and pressure changes, aiding in prey detection and navigation. Inferred due to their aquatic environment.

chemoreception.notes: Likely possessed olfactory and taste receptors for detecting chemical cues in the water, important for locating prey and navigating their environment. Inferred due to their predatory feeding habits.
